intro: Babiana flavocaesia, commonly known as the yellow-stemmed babiana, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a contrasting purple center. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its bulbs are adapted to store water, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. Babiana flavocaesia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is a popular choice in rock gardens.
